column4: Is it possible to go from 32bit Ubuntu to 64bit without having to re-install the whole O.S. ??
when I wanted to do this I did find a reference to a website that explained how to do it, but recommendations were that is was simpler to delete and start again
somsip,   oh i see.. oh well.
I ended up dual booting to a new install of 64, copying over any configs I could use from 32, and keeping 32 as a backup. Which I ended up needing after a disk death
